metadata.title: CVE-2021-20304 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - negligible.
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in OpenEXR's hufDecode functionality. This flaw allows an attacker who can pass a crafted file to be processed by OpenEXR, to trigger an undefined right shift error. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to system availability.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-20304` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libopenexr-3-1-30 - 2.5.7-1
openexr - 2.5.7-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openexr package in kinetic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.5.7-1').
